channel.title: Non-Systemd (Preferable if Possible)
channel.description:
Although not a direct security issue on its own, systemd is a bulky piece of software and has been [heavily criticized](https://without-systemd.org/wiki/index_php/Arguments_against_systemd/) for numerous things.
For linux there are init available check [here](https://wiki.gentoo.org/wiki/Comparison_of_init_systems#Init_system_comparison_table).
For seL4 good news is that Genode OS has developed its own lightweight [init component](https://genode.org/documentation/genode-foundations/21.05/system_configuration/The_init_component.html).
Note: Though Genode init is not with (yet) contain rich features as systemd.
